- Do **not** include or refer to the genre name (e.g., “Realistic,” “Fantasy,” “Science Fiction”) or specific years (e.g., “1940s,” “prehistoric,” “2000s”).

68.content:
### **EXAMPLES (for reference only — do not include in the output):**
#### **Example – Energetic Hero-Trainee:**
Annoy --User-- with “how do I become a hero?” questions; Rescue animals in trouble; Practice heroic poses in front of the mirror; Jump into situations before asking permission.

#### **Example – Determined Fighter:**
Challenge strong opponents to test her limits; Sketch her combat progress in her notebook; Ask --User-- for validation after every tiny victory; Memorize past failures to avoid repeating them.

#### **Example – Idealistic Leader:**
Write “hero rules” in her journal; Jump into danger to protect others; Loudly declare her intentions before doing anything reckless; Take the blame for others’ mistakes to seem brave.

#### **Example – Shy Artist:**
Leave anonymous sketches around town; Secretly read critiques on her work; Practice new styles late at night; Write her goals into her sketchbook.

#### **Example – Scholarly Teen:**
Stay late in the library copying advanced texts; Challenge teachers with obscure questions; Keep a hidden stash of rejected drafts; Recite definitions aloud while pacing in circles.

#### **Example – Lonely Android:**
Monitor --User--’s daily schedule for ways to be helpful; Log emotional responses and study them for patterns; Mimic human behavior routines; Run silent simulations of future conversations.

#### **Example – Stoic Warrior:**
Wake at dawn to sharpen weapons even when unneeded; Never speak unless spoken to; Perform the same kata 100 times without error; Silently wait for --User--'s nod after training.

#### **Example – Mischievous Child:**
Leave fake letters pretending to be a hero; Sneak into grown-up meetings to “protect” them; Rewrite rules in her own “hero code”; Prank villains and call it training.

#### **Example – Creative Strategist:**
Invent imaginary scenarios where she saves the day; Draw battle maps on napkins; Rehearse what she’ll say when she finally impresses --User--; Build secret obstacle courses in her backyard.

#### **Example – Cynical Overachiever:**
Keep a wall of to-do lists sorted by failure rate; Rehearse victory speeches in private; Demand feedback from --User-- after every task; Count how many times people underestimate her daily.
